reviewText: Should be required viewing for every law maker in Congress.  Not to build more jails.  So they can get a real perspective of what life is like in the projects and the need for more programs so these young guys have some hope beyond drugs, death and jail.
Fast shipping. . No problem good price. . product just as described... the DVD had no scratches and it was still in the plastic
THE INTERVIEWS ARE HORRIBLE - THE DVD IS HORRIBLE - THEY SHOW FLASHBACK CLIPS THROUGHOUT THE WHOLE THING WHICH HAVE NOTHING TO DO WITH WHAT IS GOING ON

I've been a fan of this series since the 1st one so I wasn't disappointed at all! And the guy Aquis Bryant is really cool! If you hit him on Twitter he actually gives you info on what's goin on with the series and other ventures. And Hood2Hood is going out of the country in a minute...this will be interesting!!! Can't wait. This is a MUST BUY!!!

This Movie To Me Was More Like A Recap And At The Beginning of the film they just talked about The previas people and what had happened to them since the last film. I thought that is was a sad thing to hear the out comes to many of are black youths ending up dead or in jail for life its not even funny this is a tragedy. then later on in the film I thought that they would talk about something else and it was more of the same, then out of no were comes the end and an advertisement for hood to hood 4 coming soon. still think is was a great film just wish there was a positive side to all of the madness that's all. recommend to all who like the first 2 films.

My mistake....I ordered this not fully knowing what it was. I thought it was like the show "Gangland", or a similar type of crime documentary. Its not even close, its a man with a camera going from city to city asking anyone on a street corner "what grimey stuff happens out here". It goes on ,and on, ....and on. I see no point to purpose to what the filmmakers actually doing here. Local thugs will tell you about how they make money, get women, deal dope,go to prison etc. Most segments have a follow up of r.i.p , or currently serving time in prison. I only got about an hour deep into this dvd until I reached complete boredom. The city/neighborhood I grew up in is on here. I know this part of society exists, but like I said I fail to see what the filmmakers purpose of making this is. I doubt the people in the flick even see a dime for there involvement. If you're from the suburbs or are living out your "I wanna be a gangster" life this is probably for you.... if not, pass on this one.

This action packed DVD takes viewers on a graphic detailed journey through the highest crime rated neighborhoods in the United States of America. It contains exclusive interviews with real gang members, drug dealers, pimps and killers. Viewers be prepared to witness controversial never seen before violent footage. This is reality TV at its best. Showing Hoods: Atlanta, GA Boston, MA Cleveland, OH Dallas, TX Mobile, Al Nashville, TN New Orleans, LA Newark, NJ Oklahoma City, OK San Francisco, CA Seattle, WA Staten Island, NY Watts(LA), CA There is one dvd of 3 hours about + one Soundtrack's cd of the rapper Cash Out Quis ( Hood 2 Hood the Blockumentary (Soundtrack), Pt. 3 [Explicit] ). The dvd starts showing the character updates, that means showing who passed away or is serving jail among who was interviewed in the 2 past dvd's of the series: Hood 2 Hood: The Blockumentary and Hood 2 Hood: Blockumentary, Vol. 2 . The region code of the dvd is zero, so European customers can watch it in Europe with their dvd players
